member.name: T:FastMoq.Mocker
member.summary: Initializes the mocking helper object. This class creates and manages the automatic mocking and custom mocking.
member.remarks: This class is used inside . This may be used independently; however, to ensure that mocks are not duplicated, use only one instance of this class. If using , use the property or create this class for a specific test only.

member.name: F:FastMoq.Mocker.fileSystem
member.summary: The virtual mock file system that is used by mocker unless overridden with the property.

member.name: F:FastMoq.Mocker.creatingTypeList
member.summary: The list of types in the process of being created. This is used to prevent circular creations.

member.name: P:FastMoq.Mocker.ConstructorHistory
member.remarks: Constructor history is a list of all constructors used to create instances of objects.

member.name: P:FastMoq.Mocker.DbConnection
member.summary: Gets the database connection. The default value is a memory Sqlite database connection unless otherwise set.

member.name: P:FastMoq.Mocker.HttpClient
member.summary: The virtual mock http client that is used by mocker unless overridden with the property.

member.name: P:FastMoq.Mocker.InnerMockResolution
member.summary: When creating a mocks of a class, true indicates to recursively inject the mocks inside of that class; otherwise properties are not auto mocked.

member.name: P:FastMoq.Mocker.Strict
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this is strict. Strict prevents certain features for automatically assuming or substituting preconfigured objects such as IFileSystem and HttpClient. Strict prevents private methods from being used during an invoke if public was requested. Not strict would mean that private methods may be substituted if the public methods are not found. Strict prevents private constructors from being used during object creation if public was requested. Not strict would mean that private constructors may be substituted if the public constructors are not found. Strict sets the option.
member.value: true if strict and resolution; otherwise, false uses the built-in virtual .
member.remarks: If strict, the mock does not use and uses of . Gets or sets a value indicating whether this is strict. If strict, the mock does not use the pre-built HttpClient and uses of .

member.name: T:FastMoq.MockerTestBase`1
member.summary: Mock Test Base with Automatic Mocking using . This class contains the property to create and track all Mocks from creation of the component.
member.example: Test example of the base class creating the Car class and auto mocking ICarService. Start by creating the test class that inherits . The object that is passed is the concrete class being tested. Use Property to access the test object. public class CarTest : MockerTestBase<Car> { public void TestCar() { Component.CarService.Should().NotBeNull(); } } ICarService is automatically injected into the Car object when created by the base class. public partial class Car { public Car(ICarService carService) => CarService = carService; } When needing to set up mocks before the component is created, use the property or the base class constructor. This example shows creating a database context and adding it to the Type Map for resolution during creation of objects. protected override Action<Mocker> SetupMocksAction => mocker => mocker.AddType(_ => mocker.GetMockDbContext<ApplicationDbContext>().Object);
member.typeparam: The type of the t component.

member.name: P:FastMoq.MockerTestBase`1.Component
member.summary: Gets or sets the component under test.

member.name: P:FastMoq.MockerTestBase`1.CustomMocks
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom mocks. These are added whenever the component is created.

member.summary: Gets or sets the create component action. This action is run whenever the component is created.
member.value: The action to override the component creation.

member.summary: Gets or sets the setup mocks action. This action is run before the component is created.

member.name: P:FastMoq.MockerTestBase`1.CreatedComponentAction
member.summary: Gets or sets the created component action. This action is run after the component is created.
